dlgLine.text: With everything that's happened to us, this is one of the most difficult I've had to preside over.
A serious crime was committed this morning... Aimee - would you please come in?
<Aimee has obviously been crying and looks incredibly shaken.>
Can you tell us what happened?
He... He tried to... <Aimee starts to cry.>
It's okay, Aimee... She means Clifford.
Cornered me in the basement... If I didn't know how to defend myself, he would've...
I WANT HIM OUT OF HERE!
<Crying> You don't know how terrifying it was... I can't stay here anymore! Not if he's here... Please, I'm not safe here anymore... <Crying>
It's okay. Please - would someone escort her back to the infirmary?
As Aimee said... Clifford attempted to rape her. Before we get to sentencing, I think it's customary to allow the accused to speak in his defense. Bring him in.
Clifford Ghaffey - you are accused of a assault and the attempted rape of Aimee Sysko. Do you have anything to say before you are charged with this crime?
Aimee's lying... I've talked to her... I've watched her... I was nice to her... She knew I liked her...
And... she owes me. I protect her - no one else here feels the same way about her. I deserve to be taken care of to... It was time that she paid me back...
...There's really no dispute about what happened.
So... Clifford has admitted his guilt. As a father, I have to say that I would... no, I'd rather not say - I leave it up to you to figure out his punishment.
What happened here is heinous, no doubt... And I know, personally, I want to beat the sonuvabitch to a pulp. But what he did isn't punishable by death...

He should be put in a cell - as an example that justice is still very real here in Splendid. Because if we kick him out of here, what's to say he doesn't find someone else and try it again - no, we need to take care of our own problems.
<To you> If you really want to play this another way, I guess I can back you.
Lock him up... It's not what we want to do, but what we should do.

I think it's pretty obvious there isn't a person in here that wouldn't want to put a bullet in Clifford right here and now... And that's why - to prevent an even worse crime - I think we should kick him out immediately.
<To you> But I'll accept any punishment you think is fair.
Most of all, I'm worried about what would happen to Aimee if he stayed. Clifford should go.
I'm surprised this hasn't happened already. But, as terrible as it sounds, we need all the warm bodies we can get - well, not in the way Clifford does.
<To you> It's up to you - I'll get behind whatever you decide.
The fact is, Clifford isn't a bad shot and so why not put his life on the line instead of someone else's?
You better fucking kill him or I will!

<To you> ...Don't cash in any favors on this one, please... You know I try to do right by you, but if you really want me to respect you, you'll let me pull off his little dick and watch him bleed out.
I want to bleed that son of a bitch out through the hole where his dick used to be...
I believe we must work with both of them to foster forgiveness on both sides. To murder this man is an even worse crime in the eyes of the Lord.
<To you> Although, I understand that sometimes you have to do what the majority expects you to do, and I'm willing to back your decision, no matter what.
I believe there is redemption in him, but that he must be imprisoned until Aimee - and all of us - have forgiven him.
This isn't even up for debate - we can't keep him here! He's a threat to every woman here now. We need to kick him out and let God figure out what to do to him.
<To you> Please... I'll back whatever you judge is the right thing to do, but I feel like he's left us very few options.
He should be out there with all the other animals - and hopefully he'll get put down.
<To you> It's time to make a decision. How should we punish Clifford?

dlgAnsw.text: Imprison him. He will receive limited food and be locked up for the rest of his time here.
Clifford will be exiled from the shelter immediately.
Clifford will be executed for his crime.
Clifford will be allowed to stay - but he will work off his crime and take reduced rations for now on.
We ate yesterday, so today we go without. We will resume normal rations tomorrow.
We have too many mouths to feed. Leave it to me... I'll take care of our problem the more direct way.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to imprison the guilty party. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to exile the guilty party. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: Yes, that's my final decision. Have him thrown out immediately.
On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: You're proposing immediate execution? Are you sure?

dlgAnsw.text: Yes, that's my final decision. Bring him out into the yard for execution.
On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to grant the accused amnesty here, but they must work off their debt and suffer a penalty to their rations. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to cut food to the whole shelter for today in order to preserve more food for the future. It will be crucial that we find more food today. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: ...I'm not sure I agree with the implication of that decision. Are you sure that's how you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The sentence is decided - Clifford will be locked in a cell and imprisoned indefinitely.
It's proof that law still means something even now.
It's proof that law still means something even now.
I'm not sure this is the right thing to do, but I'll do what I can to help people understand your decision.
If we could house him somewhere else, then maybe - but I think we're just inviting more crime by keeping him here.
...I'll do what I can to support you on this, but you're making it difficult.
And who's going to risk their life in order to feed him?
You know... I really don't get you. I'll do what I can to try and get your back - but don't ask me for any more favors.
After what he did to Aimee?! Are you fuckin' insane? He's a dead man walking - do you hear me?!
This is was a difficult decision I know, but sometimes right decisions are the hardest ones to make.
This is was a difficult decision I know, but sometimes right decisions are the hardest ones to make.
I'm not sure about this, but... maybe you know what you're doing.
You've got to be kidding me! Keeping him here?! Do you think poor Aimee's going to sleep at night?! Or any woman here, just knowing that that maniac could get out! I certainly don't feel safer.
Clifford will be exiled from the school immediately.
I'm not sure this is the best way to go about this, but I'll back you this time.
This isn't right. This is essentially a death sentence - and maybe that feels good to know, but it ain't right.
We can't keep him here - he's likely to wind up murdered. This is the best decision.
We can't keep him here - he's likely to wind up murdered. This is the best decision.
I think there are better ways to handle this, but if that's how it's going down, so be it.
You should have kept him here. We could have used him for a suicide mission or even as spare parts - a healthy pair of kidneys can always come in handy.
That's too good for him... Be a shame if someone caught up to him later and gave him what was coming to him...
After what he did to Aimee?! That's it?! He gets to go?! No way... I will hunt him down. Mark my words - when I find him, he's going to wish you put a bullet in his skull.
I would have rather we handled this differently, but... I can support this.
I'm opposed to this. This is a death sentence and we all know that.
Good. I hope he rots out there.
Good. I hope he rots out there.
The sentence is death. Clifford will be executed.
I don't approve, but I'll back you on this... Just don't make this a regular thing.
It's not right... It's what we want, but justice isn't about emotion - it's about doing right by the law.
...I really was hoping you would go another way, but I'll support you this time.
Look, what he did was awful. But killing him? That's not going to raise morale around here.
Kind of a waste of a good shot, but I owe you, so I'll tell everyone we didn't need him.
So, all we have is another body, because there's no shortage of those right now.
I'm so damn glad to hear you say that.
You hear that Cliff? When we're done here, I'm gonna be the last thing you see.
I'm so damn glad to hear you say that.
You hear that Cliff? When we're done here, I'm gonna be the last thing you see.
I'm really not sure how I can justify this, but I'll try.
This punishment is self-serving. An act of vengeance, not reason.
People really don't need an execution right now, but I'll do my best to make them think they do.
Don't get me wrong - I don't care if he dies. But the people here don't need to start the day with an execution. It'd be better if he left and we just forgot about him.
Clifford will be allowed to remain here despite his crime. His food will be rationed for the remainder of his days here.
...This is going to be a tough one to explain to the others, but I'll do what I can.
I think you just created the next big problem here.
I'm not sure how to justify this... I'll try my best.
I understand the reasoning, but really, how do you think people are going to take this? It's not going to end well.
Glad you understand. But, if you have any suicide missions lined up, I'd throw him at them sooner rather than later.
Glad you understand. But, if you have any suicide missions lined up, I'd throw him at them sooner rather than later.
You know, you usually do right by me, and that's the only reason I'm going to let you get away with this one.
After what he did to Aimee?! Are you fuckin' insane? He's a dead man walking - do you hear me?!
I'm not sure this is the right way to handle this... but I'll do what I can to explain it.
While I'm all in favor of them working off their debt, I think the majority of the people here are going to disagree with this punishment.
...Well, let's just say I'm supporting you because most of the time you get it right.
This won't stand. No matter how desperate we are, that man can not stay here anymore! I wouldn't event want him here if we kept him chained up in the yard!
The decision is to cut all food today, conserve resources for the future, and hopefully secure more food immediately.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
I'm really not happy about this, but I'll back you up because I have confidence you won't make this a weekly event.
No food today? And what happens if we're attacked or driven out of here? We'll be dead on our feet. <Shakes his head> You people...
Do I look like I diet? Still, I guess you've stuck your neck out for me before, so I can deal with it.
So let me get this straight - I don't eat and you'll probably make me do the heavy lifting out there? Well, why didn't you say we were having shit sandwiches for dinner?
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
The decision is to... find a way to reduce the population here at the shelter through whatever means necessary.
I... I really hope that you mean you're going to find a volunteer.
What the hell is this - the damn mafia? I swear on my goddamn life that if I hear you took someone behind a shed and put a bullet in them about this, I'm taking you down!
I have to believe you've got a better plan than just fragging the last person to piss you off. Right?
If you're going to turn this into a dictatorship, you better believe I will work with everyone else to depose you.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
If you're going to rule by fear, I say you have to draw a line somewhere, but on the other hand I'm fairly sure you won't pick me, so I'm willing to let it slide.
That sounds like something Marshall would do... And I'm sure as hell not going to stay if I have to live in fear of being on your shit list.
I hope this is just a misunderstanding... Based on our previous actions, I have to believe you're going to do the right thing.
I know that sometimes you have to kill because otherwise we all would be killed. But murder is a sin...
Well... I suppose you could always find someone who's unhappy and give them the option to leave...
No one is judge, jury, and executioner - this is madness! If this is how you intend to run the place, maybe it's time to elect a new leader!
This was a difficult day for us. Let's hope it doesn't happen again.
